Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 16 for SLE 12 SP4)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 16 for SLE 12 SP4)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 4.12.14-95_60 fixes several issues.

The following security issues were fixed:

- CVE-2020-0430: Fixed an OOB read in skb_headlen of /include/linux/skbuff.h (bsc#1176723, bsc#1178003).
- CVE-2020-12351: Fixed a type confusion while processing AMP packets aka 'BleedingTooth' aka 'BadKarma' (bsc#1177724, bsc#1177729, bsc#1178397).
- CVE-2020-25645: Fixed an an issue in IPsec that caused traffic between two Geneve endpoints to be unencrypted (bnc#1177513).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: In skb_headlen of /include/linux/skbuff.h, there is a possible out of bounds read due to memory corruption. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-153881554

Vulnerabilities.Description: Improper input validation in BlueZ may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via adjacent access.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Live Patching 15:kernel-livepatch-4_12_14-150_58-default-3-2.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Live Patching 15:kernel-livepatch-SLE15_Update_20-3-2.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: A flaw was found in the Linux kernel in versions before 5.9-rc7. Traffic between two Geneve endpoints may be unencrypted when IPsec is configured to encrypt traffic for the specific UDP port used by the GENEVE tunnel allowing anyone between the two endpoints to read the traffic unencrypted. The main threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.
